title-part.text: VEHICLES ADAPTED FOR LOAD TRANSPORTATION OR TO TRANSPORT, TO CARRY, OR TO COMPRISE SPECIAL LOADS OR OBJECTS

reference.text: vehicles with special provisions for transporting patients or disabled persons, or their personal conveyances A61G3/00

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the Explanatory Note following the class title (B60)

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
B60P1/46 covered by B60P1/4421
B60P3/022 covered by E04G21/14
B60P3/325 covered by B60P3/32
B60P3/33 covered by B60P3/34
B60P3/335 covered by B60P3/32
B60P3/345 covered by B60P3/34
B60P3/35 covered by B60P3/34
B60P3/355 covered by B60P3/34
B60P3/363 covered by B60P3/36
B60P3/367 covered by B60P3/36
B60P3/37 covered by B60P3/343
B60P3/373 covered by B60P3/32
B60P3/377 covered by B60P3/34
B60P5/00 covered by G01G19/08
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Vehicles predominantly for transporting loads and modified to facilitate loading, consolidating the load, or unloading

reference.text: vehicles for carrying harvested crops with means for self-loading or self-unloading A01D90/00; peculiar to refuse collecting-vehicles B65F; loading or unloading vehicles by means not incorporated therein B65G

reference.text: B60P1/43 takes precedence

title-part.text: with parallel up-and-down movement of load supporting or containing element

reference.text: in combination with tipping B60P1/34; devices for lifting or lowering bulky or heavy goods for loading or unloading purposes, movable on wheels or the like, e.g. fork-lift trucks, B66F9/06

CPC-specific-text.text: ; suspensions with electronic levelling control during loading or unloading B60G17/0157

the other movement being lateral displacement
the other movement being raising or lowering

mounted on the load-transporting element

reference.text: loading ramps per se B65G69/28

CPC-specific-text.text: the ramp being stored under the loading floor when not in use
the loading floor or a part thereof being movable to form the ramp
the ramp being attached to or making part of the side- or tailboards of the vehicle
the ramp being used for more than one height of loading floor
with means for balancing the weight of the ramp between use and non-use position

title-part.text: having a loading platform thereon raising the load to the level of the load-transporting element

reference.text: vehicles with special provisions for invalids comprising means for loading or unloading invalid conveyances A61G3/02

CPC-specific-text.text: and lifting achieved by pivoting of the loading platform
and keeping the loading platform parallel to the ground when raising the load
the loading platform being carried in at least one vertical guide
and pivotable in a horizontal plane
the loading platform being suspended by wires, chains or the like from horizontal rails, e.g. the rails forming part of the vehicle floor
the raising device, when not in use, being stored inside the load-transporting compartment
the loading platform, when not in use, being stored under the load-transporting surface

Warning signals, e.g. accoustic or visual
General means for controlling movements of the loading platform, e.g. hydraulic systems
Safety stops, switches
Attaching the complete loading platform unit to the vehicle
Design or construction of the moving platform itself

the load-transporting element being a container or similar
the load-transporting element being shifted horizontally in a fore and aft direction, combined or not with a vertical displacement
the load-transporting element being shifted horizontally in a crosswise direction, combined or not with a vertical displacement

fitted with articulated boom load arms for lateral displacement of the container

title-part.text: Vehicles adapted to transport, to carry or to comprise special loads or objects

reference.text: ambulances or other vehicles with special provisions for transporting patients or disabled persons, or their personal conveyances A61G3/00; hearses A61G21/00; fire-fighting land vehicles A62C27/00; refuse-collecting vehicles B65F3/00, B65F7/00; snow-removing vehicles E01H; armoured or armed vehicles F41H7/00; self-propelled mine-clearing vehicles F41H11/16
